author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs
Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 4th May 2025
media:group.media:description:
Introduction and Call to worship Psalm 30 v 4 – 7 + 12b HYMN Now is eternal life (tune: Gopsal) Opening Prayers Introduction for all ages Reading: John 21 v 1 – 19 read by Kitty HYMN Lord Christ when first you came to earth (tune: Luther’s Hymn R&S 484) Blessing Junior Church for their activities: May the Lord be with you: and also with you. Amen. Reading: Acts 9 v 1 – 6 read by Kitty HYMN How sweet the name of Jesus sounds (tune: St. Peter) Address: Prayers for others and ourselves Dedication of gifts, money, talents, time HYMN Thee we praise, high priest and victim (tune: Cross of Jesus) Communion: all invited to share in the bread and wine (non-alcoholic grape juice) to remember Jesus. Prayer of thanksgiving The Lord’s Prayer (traditional words) Distribution of communion Closing Prayer HYMN Strengthen for service, Lord the hands (tune: Ach Gott Und Herr ) Blessing
Music after the service

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Easter Sunday, 20th April 2025
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
07:44 - Entry of the Bible
07:58 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle (Duty Elder)
10:19 - Introduction and Call to worship
10:50 - 11:54 - The Easter Anthem
12:03 - 17:01 - Hymn R&S: 232 Christ the Lord is risen today (tune: Easter Hymn)
17:09 - Opening Prayers
19:43 - 21:11 - Reading: Acts 10 vv 34 – 43 read by Sarah Evans
21:17 - 23:37 - Reading: John 20 vv 1 – 18 read by Samuel Evans
23:54 - 27:30 - Introduction for all ages
27:39 - HYMN R&S: 246 The day of resurrection (tune: Ellacombe CP 502)
Blessing Junior Church for their activities: May the Lord be with you: and also with you. Amen.
30:42 - 41:24 - Address:
41:39 - 44:50 - HYMN R&S: 239 Jesus lives thy terrors now (tune: St. Albinus)
44:53 - 49:32 - Prayers for others and ourselves
Dedication of gifts, money, talents, time
49:46 - HYMN R&S: 107 The love of God comes close (tune: Rhosymedre)

Prayer of thanksgiving
The Lord’s Prayer (traditional words)
Distribution of communion
01:03:37 - Closing Prayer
01:04:41 - 01:07:52 - HYMN R&S: 236 Come ye faithful, raise the strain (tune: Ave Virgo Virginum)

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 6th April 2025
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
Welcome and lighting of peace candle (Duty Elder)
00:13 - Call to worship
00:59 - 04:29 - Hymn: Lift High the Cross R&S 422 (tune: Crucifer)
04:41 - 08:30 - Opening Prayers of Approach, Thanksgiving, Confession & Praise Confession: after ‘Lord, have mercy on us’ repeat Lord, have mercy on us. The Lord’s Prayer
Introduction to the Bible readings
09:00 - 11:08 - Reading: Philippians 3:4b-14 read by Richard Harding
11:17 - 12:26 - Reading: John 12:1-8 Jesus anointed at Bethany read by Richard Harding
12:34 - 16:46 - Talk for all ages:
Blessing Junior Church for their activities: May the Lord be with you: and also with you. Amen.
17:05 - Hymn: Just as I am, without one plea R&S 364 (tune: Saffron Walden)
20:36 - Dedication of offertory
21:26 - Hymn: Our God, Our Help in Ages Past
24:20 - 40:47 - Address followed by a time of quiet reflection
41:17 - 44:09 - Hymn: Love divine, all loves excelling R&S 663 (tune: Blaenwern)
44:25 - Communion: sharing in the bread and wine to remember Jesus.
Acclamation: Let us proclaim the mystery of faith: All: Christ has died Christ is risen. Christ will come again.
The Peace: All: Peace be with you.
Concluding prayer
55:14 - 59:25 - Prayers for others and ourselves
59:46 - 01:03:21 - Hymn: Will your anchor hold? R&S 598 (Tune: Will your anchor hold)
01:03:25 - 01:03:47 - Closing blessing
01:04:15 - 01:06:04 - Music after the service

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 30th March 2025
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
03:21 - Entry of the Bible (please stand if you are able)
03:39 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
This morning’s service is Mothering Sunday and Induction of Elders. The service has been written by Revd Angela Rigby, minister in Sevenoaks and Tonbridge. Whatever the weather, whatever is happening in your life, Angela prays you feel God’s presence with you.
05:57 - Call to worship Praise the Lord, I will praise God with all my heart Great are God’s works; we delight in them and are amazed God’s deeds are glorious and everlasting We remember them with thankfulness. God is gracious and compassionate. God provided food for those who fear God The works of God are faithful and just. All God’s teachings are trustworthy. God has redeemed God’s people.
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom; all who follow God’s teaching have good understanding. To God belongs eternal praise.
07:00 - Hymn: Come, now is the time to Worship
09:08 - Opening Prayers Confession Declaration of Forgiveness
10:53 - 12:27 - Hymn R&S 114: Let all the world
Junior Church continues activities in the Meeting Place or at the back of church (and we share a blessing – The Lord be with you; and also, with you)
12:55 - Induction of Elders
25:06 - Prayer for Illumination
27:15 - 29:05 - Reading: Proverbs 9: 1.18 read by Tony Hatton
29:37 - Hymn: R&S 329: There’s a Spirit in the Air
33:06 - 34:26 - Reading: St John 6: 51-60 read by Elsje Hatton
34:46 - 48:04 - Address:
48:14 - 51:12 - Hymn: R&S 552: The King of Love my Shepherd is
51:14 - Offertory Prayer (we do not take up an offertory)
51:54 - 54:09 - Prayers of Intercession Let us join together in saying the Lord’s prayer: Our Father who art in heaven ………..
54:11 - Distribution of Mothering Sunday gifts by Junior Church
55:47 - 58:57 - Hymn: TP 16: Blessed Assurance
58:59 - 59:21 - Closing blessing:
01:00:36 - 01:02:06 - Music after the service
Church Copyright Licence: 36750 Streaming Plus Licence: 133445 Music Reproduction Licence: 36750 Church Video Licence: 1294601 PPL Church Licence: 1824088 CLA Church Licence: 953431 PRS for Music Church Licence: 953424 OneLicense: 741270-A

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 16th March 2025
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
04:30 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
09:07 - Call to worship Let us not be afraid in the darkness , The Lord is our light. And in the uncertainty of these days, The Lord is our salvation. Let enter God’s presence with hope and gratitude Let us know this day: The Lord is the stronghold of our lives.
09:39 - HYMN Praise to the Lord, the Almighty
13:05 - Prayer of adoration and confession Lord’s Prayer
16:03 - 25:05 - Introduction for all ages: ‘loving the city’
25:13 - 26:22 - Reading: Psalm 122 read by Abigail
26:29 - 30:58 - Pray for the peace of Jerusalem and Washington and Kiev and London and…..
31:17 - HYMN From heaven you came
Introduction to the reading
35:31 - 37:04 - Reading: Luke 13.31-35 NIVUK read by Jeany Jesus’ sorrow for Jerusalem 31 At that time some Pharisees came to Jesus and said to him, ‘Leave this place and go somewhere else. Herod wants to kill you.’ 32 He replied, ‘Go and tell that fox, “I will keep on driving out demons and healing people today and tomorrow, and on the third day I will reach my goal.” 33 In any case, I must press on today and tomorrow and the next day – for surely no prophet can die outside Jerusalem! 34 ‘Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those sent to you, how often I have longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you were not willing. 35 Look, your house is left to you desolate. I tell you, you will not see me again until you say, “Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.”’
37:47 - HYMN Bless the Lord, O my soul
41:34 - 55:58 - Address
56:28 - 57:56 - HYMN Day by day dear Lord
58:03 - 01:02:33 - Prayers of thanksgiving and intercession
01:03:52 - 01:06:38 - HYMN Thou whose almighty word
01:06:39 - 01:07:03 - Blessing
01:07:23 - 01:11:15 - Music after the service

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 23rd February 2025
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
07:25 - Entry of the bible
09:18 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
10:25 - Call to worship Your love, Lord, reaches to the heavens, your faithfulness to the skies. Your righteousness is like the highest mountains, your justice like the great deep. You, Lord, preserve both people and animals. How priceless is your unfailing love, O God! People take refuge in the shadow of your wings, they feast on the abundance of your house; you give them drink from your river of delight. For with you is the fountain of life; in your light we see light.
11:27 - 15:03 - Hymn: R&S 95: God is love: Let Heaven adore Him.
15:08 - Prayers of Approach, Confession and Forgiveness The Lord’s Prayer
16:43 - 19:34 - Hymn: R&S 92: Amazing Grace
19:51 - 21:33 - Reading: John 2: 1-11 read this morning by Else Hatton
21:57 - Hymn: R&S 96: Great is thy faithfulness
26:02 - Junior Church continues with activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing - The Lord be with you; and also with you) or there are activities at the back of the church.
26:19 - 41:13 - Address:
41:31 - Hymn: Trinity Praise 16: Blessed Assurance Jesus is mine
44:47 - 48:12 - Prayers of Intercession Offering Prayer (we do not take up an offertory)
48:26 - Hymn: R&S 104 Praise my Soul the King of Heaven
51:58 - 52:22 - Blessing
52:57 - 55:28 - Music after the service

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 9th February 2025
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
03:09 - Entry of the bible and welcome
06:40 - Call to worship (Psalm 138.1-5) I will praise you, Lord, with all my heart; before the ‘gods’ I will sing your praise. 2 I will bow down towards your holy temple and will praise your name for your unfailing love and your faithfulness, for you have so exalted your solemn decree that it surpasses your fame. 3 When I called, you answered me; you greatly emboldened me. 4 May all the kings of the earth praise you, Lord, when they hear what you have decreed. 5 May they sing of the ways of the Lord, for the glory of the Lord is great.
05:57 - 09:12 - Hymn - How shall I sing that majesty
09:17 - Opening Prayers and the Lord’s Prayer
13:11 - 15:20 - Reading: Luke 5. 1 – 11 read by Alan
15:31 - 19:35 - Introduction to the service (All age talk)
19:45 - Hymn Will you come and follow me (Tune: Kelvingrove)
22:45 - 24:42 - Reading: 1 Corinthians 15. 1 – 11 read by Alan
24:45 - 28:02 - Hymn I heard the voice of Jesus say (Tune: Kingsfold)
28:44 - 39:08 - Address
39:33 - 42:59 - Hymn Be thou my vision (Tune: Slane)
43:04 - 49:17 - Prayers of intercession
49:34 - 52:37 - Hymn Forth in thy name o Lord I go (Tune: Angels Song)
52:38 - 53:00 - Blessing
53:21 - 56:56 - Music after the service

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - 12th January 2025
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
06:33 - Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able)
06:43 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
08:17 - 09:52 - Call to worship
10:27 - 13:02 - Hymn: R&S 536 New every morning is the love (Tune: Melcombe)
13:10 - 17:07 - Opening prayers of adoration and confession and the Lord’s Prayer
17:10 - Checking in
21:54 - 23:17 - Reading: Luke 3:15-22 (NIV) read by Sarah Evans
23:24 - 26:35 - Introduction for all ages
27:00 - 30:00 - Hymn: R&S 591 Do not be afraid: OT reading for today (Tune: Do not be afraid)
Junior Church continue activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing – the Lord be with you; and also with you) or there are activities at back of church.
30:47 - 31:22 - Reading: Acts 8:14-17 (NIV) read by Sarah Evans
31:34 - 33:35 - Hymn: R&S 431 Lord of the love that in Christ has reclaimed us (Tune: Epiphany Hymn)
24:07 - 48:45 - Address: Hearing God’s voice and responding.
49:21 - 51:50 - Hymn: R&S 355 Jesus call us (Tune: Cross of Jesus)
51:54 - 01:00:22 - Prayers of Intercession Offering prayer
01:00:27 - Thought for the week
01:02:31 - 01:06:52 - Hymn: Have you heard God’s voice? 1. Have you heard God’s voice; has your heart been stirred? Are you still prepared to follow? Have you made a choice to remain and serve, though the way be rough and narrow? Refrain (except the last time) Will you walk the path that will cost you much and embrace the pain and sorrow? Will you trust in One who entrusts to you the disciples of tomorrow?
2. Will you use your voice; will you not sit down when the multitudes are silent? Will you make a choice to stand your ground when the crowds are turning violent? Refrain 3. In your city streets will you be God’s heart? Will you listen to the voiceless? Will you stop and eat, and when friendships start, will you share your faith with the faithless? Refrain 4. Will you watch the news with the eyes of faith and believe it could be different? Will you share your views using words of grace? Will you leave a thoughtful imprint? Final Refrain: We will walk the path that will cost us much and embrace the pain and sorrow. We will trust in One who entrusts to us the disciples of tomorrow.
01:06:54 - 01:07:15 - Closing blessing
01:07:40 - 01:11:23 - Music after the service
#advent #AdventCandle #AdventRing #StickMan #JuliaDonaldson #ImStickManThatsMe

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - 5th January 2025
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
06:45 - Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able),
07:00 - Welcome and Lighting of peace candle (by Duty Elder)
08:10 - Call to worship
09:20 - 12:20 - HYMN Worship the Lord
12:33 - 14:46 - Prayer of adoration and confession
14:52 - 23:38 - Introduction for all ages: ‘12 th Day of Christmas and…’
23:53 - 25:53 - HYMN Born in the night Junior Church continue activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing – the Lord be with you; and also with you) or there are activities at back of church.
Introduction to the readings 26:51 - 28:10 - Reading: John 1. 10 – 18 NIVUK read by Linda
28:16 - Reading Psalm 117 (Lectern side / keyboard side) L Praise the Lord, all nations everywhere. K Praise God, all the peoples of the earth. L For God loves us very dearly, K and God’s truth endures. ALL PRAISE THE LORD. K Praise the Lord, all nations everywhere. L Praise God, all the peoples of the earth. K For God loves us very dearly, L and God’s truth endures. ALL PRAISE THE LORD.
29:43 - 31:17 - Reading: Ephesians 1.3-14 NIVUK read by Linda
31:50 - 33:51 - HYMN Peace perfect peace
34:16 - 46:53 - Short Address
47:29 - 50:55 - Prayers of intercessions
51:43 - 53:53 - HYMN Christ is coming, TUNE: RS 184 DIX Christ is coming, Christ has come, let the world prepare a room. God says: Light! and makes our day: fear and chaos lose their say. In our darkness shines our Sun; God has made a date with man.
Christ has come, will come again, parable of God and Man. Lord of all our unborn days, world renewing turn of phrase, Word in season for all time, godly reason, godly rhyme.
Let the earth make time and room for the Man who is to come. He, the centre of our feast, makes himself of all the least. Stones and voices all proclaim: There is bread in Bethlehem! Fred Kaan © 1975 Hope Publishing Company CCLL 36750
53:57 - Thanksgiving Prayer and Lord’s Prayer Distribution of bread and wine (non-alcoholic grape juice)
01:02:08 - Final prayer
01:04:36 - 01:08:10 - HYMN Lord for the years
01:08:11 - 01:08:39 - Blessing
01:09:01 - 01:11:34 - Music after the service
#advent #AdventCandle #AdventRing #StickMan #JuliaDonaldson #ImStickManThatsMe

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - 29th December 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
05:10 - Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able)
05:13 - Welcome and lighting of the peace candle
06:35 - Call to Worship (Psalm 148. 1 – 5)
07:33 - 12:29 - Hymn Of the Fathers love begotten
12:33 - 15:54 - Opening Prayers and the Lord’s Prayer
16:20 - 16:59 - Reading: 1 Samuel 2. 18 -20 and 26 18 But Samuel was ministering before the Lord – a boy wearing a linen ephod. 19 Each year his mother made him a little robe and took it to him when she went up with her husband to offer the annual sacrifice. 20 Eli would bless Elkanah and his wife, saying, ‘May the Lord give you children by this woman to take the place of the one she prayed for and gave to the Lord.’ Then they would go home. 26 And the boy Samuel continued to grow in stature and in favour with the Lord and with people.
17:07 - 21:16 - Introduction to the service (All age talk)
21:28 - 23:49 - Hymn Unto us a boy is born
24:12 - 25:36 - Reading: Luke 2. 41 – 52 41 Every year Jesus’ parents went to Jerusalem for the Festival of the Passover. 42 When he was twelve years old, they went up to the festival, according to the custom. 43 After the festival was over, while his parents were returning home, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem, but they were unaware of it. 44 Thinking he was in their company, they travelled on for a day. Then they began looking for him among their relatives and friends. 45 When they did not find him, they went back to Jerusalem to look for him. 46 After three days they found him in the temple courts, sitting among the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions. 47 Everyone who heard him was amazed at his understanding and his answers. 48 When his parents saw him, they were astonished. His mother said to him, ‘Son, why have you treated us like this? Your father and I have been anxiously searching for you.’ 49 ‘Why were you searching for me?’ he asked. ‘Didn’t you know I had to be in my Father’s house?’[a] 50 But they did not understand what he was saying to them. 51 Then he went down to Nazareth with them and was obedient to them. But his mother treasured all these things in her heart. 52 And Jesus grew in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.
26:01 - 28:58 - Hymn Take my life and let it be
29:28 - 38:06 - Address
38:30 - 40:21 - Hymn 146 Away in a manger
40:25 - 44:20 - Prayers of intercession
44:37 - 49:21 - Hymn In the bleak mid winter
49:21 - 49:43 - Blessing
50:04 - 52:12 - Music after the service
#advent #AdventCandle #AdventRing

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Christmas Day, 25th December 2024
media:group.media:description:
00:00 - Music and photos before the service
06:05 - 08:33 - Carol to prepare for worship R&S 153 On Christmas night
08:38 - Welcome and introduction (including lighting of peace candle)
10:18 - Call to worship Into this space, into our prayers, Jesus, we welcome you. Into our sadnesses, into our celebrations, Jesus, we welcome you. Into our homes, into our families, Jesus, we welcome you. Into our lives, into our hearts, Jesus, we welcome you. We offer our worship, we offer our thanks For you are ‘God with us’ now and for ever. Amen.
11:04 - HYMN R&S 160 O come all ye faithful (omit verses 3 and 4)
14:37 - Lighting the Advent Candles and opening prayer Lord Jesus, be with us in all our celebrations today. Shine your light into our lives. Bring your love, hope and peace to our broken world, that all creation may learn the song of the angels: Glory to God in the highest and peace on earth. Amen.
18:09 - SONG Tune: Frère Jacques Christ our Lord: Christ our Lord, light our lives light our lives. We’ll be lights to others: we’ll be lights to others. Light our lives: light our lives.
19:22 - 25:40 - Introduction: ‘simply the best!’
25:51 - 26:48 - Reading: Luke 2. 1 – 7 read by Julia Sparks
27:01 - 28:41 - HYMN R&S 149 Infant lowly, infant holy
29:06 - 30:51 - Reading: Luke 2. 8 – 20 read by Stephen Burton
31:02 - 33:46 - Reflection: ‘The child in a manger’
33:55 - 36:06 - HYMN R&S 166 Come and join the celebration
36:23 - 41:58 - Prayers for those in need with the response God with us, be with them. Lord’s Prayer
42:59 - 47:14 - HYMN R&S 157 See, in yonder manger low
47:15 - 47:44 - Blessing
47:57 - 49:42 - Music after the service
#advent #AdventCandle #AdventRing

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Carols with Candlelight - Sunday, 15th December 2024 4pm
media:group.media:description:
Welcome to this special service. We hope you enjoy the worship and are able to stay for refreshments afterwards.
07:23 - Welcome
08:45 - Call to worship led by the minister, Terry Hinks Jesus said ‘I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will not walk in darkness but will have the light of life.’ In the tender mercy of our God, the dawn from on high has broken upon us, to give light to those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, and to guide our feet into the way of peace.
09:42 - 14:24 - Carol: O come all ye faithful
14:32 - Lighting of the Advent Candles and Opening Prayer
17:49 - 20:59 - Carol: Silent night
21:16 - 22:29 - 1st Bible Reading: Isaiah 52. 7 – 10 Harri
23:03 - 24:57 - Reading: ‘Christmas Bells’ Arthur
25:02 - 28:35 - Carol: It came upon a midnight clear
28:42 - 29:53 - 2nd Bible Reading: Luke 2: 1–7 Rosemary
30:36 - 33:11 - Carol: O sad and troubled Bethlehem [on screen - tune R&S 145]
33:24 - A Prayer for Peace
35:43 - 37:13 - 3rd Bible Reading: Luke 2: 8 – 20 Richard
Carol: See him lying on a bed of straw (Band) [on screen or R&S 151]
40:26 - 41:16 - Reading: ‘A work in progress’ Jeanny
41:24 - Songs: Meekness and majesty (vs 1 and 3) 43:37 - Longing for light (vs 1 and 2)
45:22 - 47:13 - 4th Bible Reading: Matthew 2: 1 – 12 Samuel
47:26 - Introducing our charity: Embrace the Middle East - slides and video
52:24 - 53:08 - Reading: ‘What God sent’ Sheila
53:17 - 54:50 - Carol Love came down at Christmas
54:57 - 57:00 - 5th Bible Reading: John 1: 1 – 14 Terry
57:06 - 01:01:00 - Prayers for the world God loves and the Lord’s Prayer All: Our Father, who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name; thy kingdom come; thy will be done; on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our trespasses, as we forgive those who trespass against us. And lead us not into temptation; but deliver us from evil. For thine is the kingdom, the power, and the glory, for ever and ever. Amen.
01:02:27 - Carol: Hark! the herald angels sing [on screen or R&S 159]
01:05:35 - 01:06:01 - Minister: Blessing All say: Amen.
01:06:21 - 01:09:28 - Organ Voluntary
Retiring Collection in aid of Embrace the Middle East (working with Christian partners to respond to the desperate need the Middle East caught up in warfare and tackle long-term poverty and injustice) For more information see the website: https://embraceme.org/
#advent #AdventCandle #AdventRing

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 15th December 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
05:32 - Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able)
05:40 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle (an elder)
07:35 - Call to worship
08:04 - 11:35 - Hymn Long ago prophets knew Tune: R & S 274 Theodoric
11:40 - 14:26 - Opening Prayers and the Lord’s Prayer
14:32 - 18:25 - Talk for all ages: ‘making clean’
16:54 - 18:25 - Reading Luke 3.15-16 (The Message) The interest of the people by now was building. They were all beginning to wonder, “Could this John be the Messiah?” But John intervened: “I’m baptizing you here in the river. The main character in this drama, to whom I’m a mere stagehand, will ignite the kingdom life, a fire, the Holy Spirit within you, changing you from the inside out. He’s going to clean house—make a clean sweep of your lives.
18:29 - Lighting of the Advent Candles and prayer
Today we light 3 candles, the 1 st to remember for the great hope God has given us, the 2 nd to give thanks for the Bible and the prophets. And now the 3 rd candle to give thanks for John the Baptist, who prepared the way for Jesus. God of hope, come to us again this Advent. Prepare us in heart and mind to welcome your light and walk in your way. Amen
19:58 - 22:49 - Hymn - R&S 141 Make way, make way
Junior Church continue activities in the Meeting Place (and we share a blessing – the Lord be with you; and also with you) or there are activities at the back of church.
Introduction to Bible readings
23:29 - 25:15 - Readings: Zephaniah 3.14-20 read by Abigail Lokko
25:34 - 26:23 - Isaiah 12.2 – 6 read by Alan Yates and congregation Surely God is my salvation; I will trust and not be afraid. The Lord, the Lord himself, is my strength and my defence; he has become my salvation.’ 3 With joy you will draw water from the wells of salvation. ‘Give praise to the Lord, proclaim his name; make known among the nations what he has done, and proclaim that his name is exalted. 5 Sing to the Lord, for he has done glorious things; let this be known to all the world. 6 Shout aloud and sing for joy, people of Zion, for great is the Holy One of Israel among you.
26:26 - 27:17 - Reading: Philippians 4.4-7 read by Alan Yates
27:41 - Hymn R&S 286 Rejoice in the Lord (sung as a round)
29:55 - 40:45 - Address followed by time of quiet reflection
40:48 - HYMN Don’t be afraid, my love is stronger My love is stronger than your fear. Don’t be afraid, my love is stronger And I have promised, promised to be always near.
43:05 - 50:12 - Prayers of thanksgiving and intercession
50:41 - 52:42 - Hymn - R&S 150 Child in the manger
52:43 - 53:10 - Blessing
53:26 - 56:07 - Music after the service

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 1st December 2024
media:group.media:description:
Morning worship and remembrance from Trinity United Reformed Church, High Wycombe
00:00:00 - Music before the service
05:50 - Entry of Bible (please stand if you are able)
05:58 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle (an elder)
08:00 - 08:40 - Call to worship Minister: In our watching and waiting: All: Come, Lord Jesus. Minister: In our hopes and fears: All: Come, Lord Jesus. Minister: In our stillness and worship: All: Come, Lord Jesus. Minister: Come, Lord Jesus, bless and surprise us, as we look forward to the celebration of your birth and the final victory of your kingdom.
09:22 - 11:56 - Hymn - Tell out my soul 740
12:00 - Opening Prayers
14:28 - 22:10 - Introduction: ‘getting ready’
22:12 - Lighting first candle on Advent crown Minister: We light our first candle, as a sign of our hope that peace and justice will come to our world: All: God of hope, come to us again this Advent. May your hope live within us, burning as a light in our lives. Amen.
23:49 - 26:12 - Hymn - Like a candle flame
27:06 - 28:33 - Readings: Jeremiah 33. 14 – 16 read by Lesley Psalm 25. 1 – 5 read by Lesley and congregation Reader: In you, Lord my God, I put my trust. All: I trust in you; do not let me be put to shame, nor let my enemies triumph over me. Reader: No one who hopes in you will ever be put to shame, but shame will come on those who are treacherous without cause. All: Show me your ways, Lord, teach me your paths. Reader: Guide me in your truth and teach me, All: for you are God my Saviour, and my hope is in you all day long. Amen.
28:49 - 30:50 - Reading Luke 21.25 – 36 read by Ian
31:41 - 34:18 - Hymn - O come O come Emmanuel (vs 1,2 and 6)
34:53 - 47:56 - Short Address
48:05 - 53:23 - Prayers of intercession Minister: Lord, your kingdom come All: your will be done.
53:30 - Offering of bread and wine and Offering Prayer We invite you to share in the bread and wine (grape juice) at church (or at home) united in the name of Christ.
54:48 - Hymn - Be known to us in breaking bread
56:17 - Thanksgiving Prayer and Lord’s Prayer
59:07 - Distribution of bread and wine
01:05:02 - Closing Prayer
01:07:49 - 01:10:10 - Hymn - Joy to the world R&S135
01:10:12 - 01:10:42 - Blessing
01:11:08 - 01:14:35 - Music after the service
